item.title: Three months of Central America and Mexico in photos
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Starting out a trip through Central America with six weeks of learning to surf on the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica was a good beginning. From there on it just got better: road tripping around the bumpy roads of Costa Rica in a Suzuki Jimny, exploring Monteverde Cloud Forest, hiking up volcanoes and staying in a […]

The post Three months of Central America and Mexico in photos appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: What I love about Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
On my second visit to Costa Rica, I grew to love this tiny country even more than I did before. I experienced what it’s like to live in a beach community, learned to surf, practised yoga surrounded by jungle, drove around winding roads in a 4×4, hiked through a forest at night to find sleeping […]

The post What I love about Costa Rica appeared first on Duff's Suitcase.

item.title: Finding surf and yoga zen in Nosara
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff
item.description:
Nosara is one of those places that you arrive in and on your first day you think “I could live here”. It’s the kind of place that makes people change their flights, cancel other travel plans, or, in many cases – decide to relocate. On the Pacific Coast of Costa Rica’s Nicoya Peninsula, Nosara is a […]
